member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.LinkType.ViewBoundScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to scale all bounding box parameters.
member.remarks: A value less than 1 specifies to use a geographic area less than the current geographic view. A value greater than 1 specifies to use a geographic area greater than the current geographic view. The value shall be positive.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.LinkType.ViewFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format of a query string related to view parameters that is appended to the before the resource is fetched.
member.remarks:
The following query parameters may be used:
[lookatLon], [lookatLat]
Longitude and latitude of the point that LookAt is viewing.
[lookatRange], [lookatTilt], [lookatHeading]
Values used by the LookAt element (the Range, Tilt, and Heading properties).
[lookatTerrainLon], [lookatTerrainLat], [lookatTerrainAlt]
Point on the terrain in decimal degrees/meters that LookAt is viewing.
[cameraLon], [cameraLat], [cameraAlt]
Decimal degrees/meters of the eye point for the camera.
[horizFov], [vertFov]
Horizontal, vertical field of view for the camera.
[horizPixels], [vertPixels]
Size in pixels of the geographic view.
[terrainEnabled]
Indicates whether the geographic view is showing terrain.
[bboxWest], [bboxSouth], [bboxEast], [bboxNorth]
Bounding box limits matching the OGC Web Map Service (WMS) bounding box specification.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.LinkType.ViewRefreshTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds to wait before refreshing the geographic view after camera movement stops.

member.remarks: A value of 0 indicates that the view is aimed straight down toward the earth (the most common case). A value of 90 indicates that the view is aimed towards the horizon. Values greater than 90 indicate that the view is pointed up into the sky. Values are clamped at +180 degrees.

member.name: T:SharpKml.Dom.ColorMode
member.summary: Specifies the color mode for a graphic element.

remarks.para: OGC KML 2.2 Section 16.7
If the value is then the color components are modified as follows:

item.description: If a single color component is specified (for example equals 255), random color values for that one component will be selected. In this case, the values would range from 0 (black) to 255 (full red).

If values for two or for all three color components are specified, a random linear scale is applied to each color component, with results ranging from black to the maximum values specified for each component.
The opacity of a color () is never randomized.

member.summary: Use a single color value.

member.name: F:SharpKml.Dom.ColorMode.Random
member.summary: Use a random color value.

member.summary: Interpret the altitude in meters relative to the terrain elevation.

member.name: F:SharpKml.Dom.AltitudeMode.Absolute
member.summary: Interpret the altitude as a value in meters relative to the vertical datum.

member.name: T:SharpKml.Dom.Lod
member.summary: Specifies the Level Of Detail to use when displaying a .

remarks.para: OGC KML 2.2 Section 9.18

An earth browser should calculate the size of the when projected onto screen space then compute the square root of the Region's area. For example, if an untiled Region is square and the viewpoint is directly above it, this measurement is equal to the width of the projected Region. If this measurement falls within the limits defined by and , and if the is in view, then the Region should be activated. If this limit is not reached, the associated geometry should not be drawn since it would be too far from the user's viewpoint to be visible.
See the standard for further details of how to handle and .

member.remarks: This ramp value, expressed in pixels, is applied at the maximum end of the visibility limits.

member.summary: Gets or sets a measurement (in pixels) that represents the maximum limit of the visibility range.
member.remarks: A value of -1.0 indicates "active to infinite size."

member.name: T:SharpKml.Dom.Atom.Link
member.summary: Defines a reference from an entry or feed to a Web resource.
member.remarks: RFC 4287 Section 4.2.7 (see http://atompub.org/rfc4287.html)

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.Atom.Link.Href
member.summary: Gets or sets the Link's URI.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.Atom.Link.HrefLang
member.summary: Gets or sets the language of the resource pointed to by .
member.remarks: Value must be a language tag [RFC 3066]. When used together with the Relation="alternate", it implies a translated version of the entry.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.Atom.Link.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets an advisory length of the linked content in octets.
member.remarks: This is a hint about the content length of the representation returned when the value of is dereferenced. Note that Length does not override the actual content length of the representation as reported by the underlying protocol.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.Atom.Link.MediaType
member.summary: Gets or sets an advisory media type.
member.remarks: The value must conform to the syntax of a MIME media type [RFC 4288]. This is a hint about the type of the representation that is expected to be returned when the value of Href is dereferenced. Note that MediaType does not override the actual media type returned with the representation.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.Atom.Link.Relation
member.summary: Gets or sets the Link's relation type.
member.remarks:
If the value is not present, the Link must be interpreted as if Relation is "alternate". There are five initial values for the Registry of Link Relations:
alternate
Signifies that the value in Href identifies an alternate version of the resource described by the containing element.
related
Signifies that the value in Href identifies a resource related to the resource described by the containing element.
self
Signifies that value in Href identifies a resource equivalent to the containing element.
enclosure
Signifies that the value in Href identifies a related resource that is potentially large in size and might require special handling.
via
Signifies that the value in Href identifies a resource that is the source of the information provided in the containing element.
member.example: The feed for a site that discusses the performance of the search engine at "http://search.example.com" might contain, as a child of atom:feed: <link rel="related" href="http://search.example.com/"/> An identical link might appear as a child of any atom:entry whose content contains a discussion of that same search engine.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.Atom.Link.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets human-readable information about the Link.
member.remarks: The content is Language-Sensitive.

xsd:double Compatible with System.Double
xsd:int Compatible with System.Int32
xsd:float Compatible with System.Single
xsd:short Compatible with System.Int16
xsd:string Compatible with System.String
xsd:unsignedInt Compatible with System.UInt32
xsd:unsignedShort Compatible with System.UInt16

member.name: T:SharpKml.Dom.ImagePyramid
member.summary: Specifies a hierarchical set of images, each of which is an increasingly lower resolution (towards the top of the pyramid).

remarks.para: OGC KML 2.2 Section 11.6
Each image in the pyramid is subdivided into tiles so only the portions in view are loaded.

The pixel size of the original image is specified by and . The width and height can be any size and do not need to be a power of 2. You can fill out the remaining pixels with blank pixels (as described in Section 11.6.3)
Tiles must be square, and the must be a power of 2. A tile size of 256 (the default) or 512 is recommended.
See Section 11.4.3 for handling large images and Section 11.6.3 for creating an Image Pyramid.

member.summary: Gets or sets the height, in pixels, of the original image.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.ImagePyramid.TileSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the tiles, in pixels.
member.remarks: Tiles must be square, and TileSize must be a power of 2. A tile size of 256 (the default) or 512 is recommended. The original image is divided into tiles of this size, at varying resolutions.

member.name: T:SharpKml.Dom.Region
member.summary: Affects the visibility of a .

remarks.para: OGC KML 2.2 Section 9.13
Regions define both culling and level-of-detail control over the display of the , including elements that are defined lower in the hierarchy.
A Region is said to be "active" when the bounding box is within the user's view and the LOD requirements are met. Feature elements associated with a Region are drawn only when the Region is active.
When is , the or is loaded only when the Region is active. In a or hierarchy, this calculation uses the Region that is the closest ancestor in the hierarchy.

member.name: T:SharpKml.Dom.PhotoOverlay
member.summary: Used to position a photograph relative to the camera viewpoint and also to define field-of-view parameters.

remarks.para: OGC KML 2.2 Section 11.4

The PhotoOverlay may be rendered on one of three shapes (as determined by hape):
A 2D planar rectangle.
A cylinder (for a panoramic photo).
A sphere (for a spherical panorama).

The photo overlay faces toward the viewpoint and its center is placed at the head of the view vector. The view vector is defined as the vector based at the viewpoint and in the direction specified by the corresponding element. The length of the view vector is determined by the value of . The photo overlay is positioned such that the view vector points toward the photo and is orthogonal to the center of the image (see Section 11.4.2).
The URL for the PhotoOverlay image is specified in in the property.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.NetworkLink.FlyToView
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to adjust the geographic view upon activation.

remarks.para: A value of false indicates that the geographic view shall remain unchanged.

A value of true indicates that the geographic view shall be displayed according to the specified by either:
a
a child of
if they exist in the referenced KML resource. The AbstractView of the NetworkLinkControl shall take precedence over the AbstractView of the Feature if they both exist. If neither exists then the view shall remain unchanged.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.NetworkLink.RefreshVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the visibility of any s within the referenced KML resource.

remarks.para: A value of false shall leave the visibility of any referenced Features in the geographic view within the control of the earth browser user.
A value of true shall require any referenced Features to be visible within the geographic view whenever they are refreshed.

member.name: T:SharpKml.Dom.ViewVolume
member.summary: Defines how much of the current scene in a is visible.

remarks.para: OGC KML 2.2 Section 11.5

Specifying the field of view is analogous to specifying the lens opening in a physical camera. A small field of view, like a telephoto lens, focuses on a small part of the scene. A large field of view, like a wide-angle lens, focuses on a large part of the scene.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.ViewVolume.Bottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle, in decimal degrees, from the bottom side of the view volume to camera's view vector.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.ViewVolume.Left
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle, in decimal degrees, from the left side of the view volume to the camera's view vector.
member.remarks: A negative value of the angle corresponds to a field of view that is 'left' of the view vector.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.ViewVolume.Near
member.summary: Gets or sets the length in meters of the view vector, which starts from the camera viewpoint and ends at the shape.
member.remarks: The value shall be positive.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.ViewVolume.Right
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle, in decimal degrees, from the camera's view vector to the right side of the view volume.
member.remarks: A positive value of the angle corresponds to a field of view that is 'right' of the view vector.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.ViewVolume.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle, in decimal degrees, from the camera's view vector to the top side of the view volume.

member.name: T:SharpKml.Base.MathHelpers
member.summary: Contains mathematical functions useful when working with KML or, more generally, geometry on a Great Circle.
member.remarks: Many of the formulae here were copied from the Aviation Formulary .

member.name: M:SharpKml.Base.MathHelpers.Azimuth(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the initial azimuth (the angle measured clockwise from true north) at a point from that point to a second point.
member.param: The latitude of the first point.
The longitude of the first point.
The latitude of the second point.
The longitude of the second point.
member.returns: The initial azimuth of the first point to the second point.
member.remarks: This is directly useful as the value of heading in .
member.example: The azimuth from 0,0 to 1,0 is 0 degrees. From 0,0 to 0,1 is 90 degrees (due east). The range of the result is [-180, 180].

member.name: M:SharpKml.Base.MathHelpers.DegreesToRadians(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts the specified value in degrees to radians.
member.param: The angle in degrees.
member.returns: The specified angle converted to radians.

member.name: M:SharpKml.Base.MathHelpers.Distance(SharpKml.Base.Vector,SharpKml.Base.Vector)
member.summary: Calculates the great circle distance in meters between two points.
member.param: The location of the first point.
The location of the second point.
member.returns: The great circle distance in meters.
member.remarks: The antemeridian is not considered.

member.name: M:SharpKml.Base.MathHelpers.Distance(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the great circle distance in meters between two points on the Earth's surface.
member.param: The latitude of the first point.
The longitude of the first point.
The latitude of the second point.
The longitude of the second point.
member.returns: The great circle distance in meters.
member.remarks: The antemeridian is not considered.

member.name: M:SharpKml.Base.MathHelpers.Distance(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the great circle distance in meters between two points in all three dimensions.
member.param: The latitude of the first point.
The longitude of the first point.
The altitude of the first point.
The latitude of the second point.
The longitude of the second point.
The altitude of the second point.
member.returns: The great circle distance in meters.
member.remarks: The antemeridian is not considered.

member.name: M:SharpKml.Base.MathHelpers.Elevation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the angle from the horizontal plane between the two altitudes.
member.param: The latitude of the first point.
The longitude of the first point.
The altitude of the first point.
The latitude of the second point.
The longitude of the second point.
The altitude of the second point.
member.returns: The angle from the horizontal plane in degrees.
member.remarks: This is a naive implementation accurate only over short distances and does not account for surface curvature. To use this as the value of KML's tilt, add 90 degrees (since in KML a tilt of 0 is vertical).
member.example: The returned angle from (37.00, -121.98, 600) to a point about 1778 meters west, 400 meters below at (37.00, -122.00, 200) is -12.7 degrees.

member.name: M:SharpKml.Base.MathHelpers.GroundDistance(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the absolute distance between the ground point and the point directly under the end of the specified vector.
member.param: The distance in meters.
The angle in degrees from the horizontal plane.
member.returns: The absolute ground distance in meters.

member.name: M:SharpKml.Base.MathHelpers.Height(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the absolute height between the ground point and the point directly under the end of the specified vector.
member.param: The distance in meters.
The angle in degrees from the horizontal plane.
member.returns: The absolute height in meters.

member.name: M:SharpKml.Base.MathHelpers.MetersToRadians(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts the specified distance in meters to radians.
member.param: The distance in meters.
member.returns: The specified distance converted to radians.

member.name: M:SharpKml.Base.MathHelpers.RadialPoint(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates a point at the specified distance along a radial from a center point.
member.param: The latitude of the center point.
The longitude of the center point.
The distance in meters.
The radial in degrees, measures clockwise from north.
member.returns: A containing the Latitude and Longitude of the calculated point.
member.remarks: The antemeridian is not considered.

member.name: M:SharpKml.Base.MathHelpers.RadiansToDegrees(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts the specified value in radians to degrees.
member.param: The angle in radians.
member.returns: The specified angle converted to degrees.

member.name: M:SharpKml.Engine.FeatureExtensions.CalculateLookAt(SharpKml.Dom.Feature)
member.summary: Calculates a object from the spatial extents of the .
member.param: The feature instance.
member.returns: A LookAt object with the calculated data (see remarks) on success; otherwise, null if the bounds of the Feature could not be calculated.

remarks.para: The Altitude, Heading and Tilt values or the returned LookAt are not set. AltitudeMode is set to RelativeToGroud.
The range is computed such that the feature will be within a viewport with a field of view of 60 deg and is clamped to a minimum of 1,000 meters.

member.name: T:SharpKml.Dom.LookAt
member.summary: Specifies the geographic view in terms of a point of interest viewed from a virtual camera.

remarks.para: OGC KML 2.2 Section 14.3
The LookAt class is more limited in scope than and should establish a view direction that intersects the Earth's surface.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.LookAt.Altitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the altitude in meters, interpreted according to .

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.LookAt.AltitudeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets how should be interpreted.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.LookAt.Heading
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction (North, South, East, West), in decimal degrees.
member.remarks: Values range from 0 (North) to 360 degrees.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.LookAt.Latitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the geodetic latitude of the point the camera is looking at.
member.remarks: Value is in decimal degrees north or south of the Equator (0 degrees). Values range from −90 degrees to 90 degrees.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.LookAt.Longitude
member.summary: Gets or sets the geodetic longitude of the point the camera is looking at.
member.remarks: The angular distance is in decimal degrees, relative to the Prime Meridian. Values west of the Meridian range from −180 to 0 degrees. Values east of the Meridian range from 0 to 180 degrees.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.LookAt.Range
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance in meters from the point specified by , and to the LookAt position.

member.name: P:SharpKml.Dom.LookAt.Tilt
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle, in decimal degrees, between the direction of the LookAt position and the normal to the surface of the Earth.
member.remarks: Values range from 0 to 90 degrees and cannot be negative. A value of 0 degrees indicates viewing from directly above; a value of 90 degrees indicates viewing along the horizon.
